Detailed Description

Definitions for SPU-side signal related functions and macros.

Note that most of the signal functions initiated by SPU blocking.

Function Documentation

static void ctk_signal_read ( unsigned int  reg,
ctk_uint32_t *  data 
) [inline, static]

Reads the value of the signal notification register specified by reg. [Blocking] This blocks until it actually gets a signal notification.

Parameters:
[in] reg - specifies the signal notification register to be read. The value should be one of either CTK_SIGNAL_REG1 or CTK_SIGNAL_REG2.
[out] data - the 32-bit value
Returns:
void

static int ctk_signal_read_count ( unsigned int  reg  )  [inline, static]

Gets the count of unread signal notifications for the signal notification register specified by reg.

Parameters:
[in] reg - specifies the signal notification register to be read. The value should be one of either CTK_SIGNAL_REG1 or CTK_SIGNAL_REG2.
Returns:
the number of unread signal notifications. A 0 value indicates no signal notification has been written.

static void ctk_signal_read_reg1 ( ctk_uint32_t *  data  )  [inline, static]

Reads the value of the signal notification register 1. [Blocking] This blocks until it actually gets a signal notification.

Parameters:
[out] data - the 32-bit value
Returns:
void

static int ctk_signal_read_reg1_count (  )  [inline, static]

Gets the count of unread signal notifications for the signal notification register 1.

Returns:
the number of unread signal notifications. A 0 value indicates the signal notification register is empty.

static void ctk_signal_read_reg2 ( ctk_uint32_t *  data  )  [inline, static]

Reads the value of the signal notification register 2. [Blocking] This blocks until it actually gets a signal notification.

Parameters:
[out] data - the 32-bit value
Returns:
void

static int ctk_signal_read_reg2_count (  )  [inline, static]

Gets the count of unread signal notifications for the signal notification register 2.

Returns:
the number of unread signal notifications. A 0 value indicates no signal notification has been written.

static void ctk_signal_send ( ea_addr_t  ea_addr,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
) [inline, static]

Sends a value to the signal notification register specified by the given EA address. [Blocking] This blocks until it actually sends the signal notification.

See also:
BE Handbook pp.574 for more details.
Parameters:
[in] ea_addr - specifies EA addr of the target signal notification register.
[in] data - the 32-bit value
Returns:
void
